title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
J&J agreed to acquire Abiomed in a $16.6 billion deal the health-products giant hopes will accelerate its overhaul into a leaner, faster-growing company.

Uber reported gains in revenue and adjusted earnings for the latest quarter as its customers spent more on rides and food delivery.

Job openings rose in September as demand for workers continued to far outpace the number of unemployed people looking for work.

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow retreating 0.4%, 0.9% and 0.2%, respectively.

Aramco posted a 39% jump in quarterly profit, as high oil prices boosted the company's earnings.

BP reported robust natural-gas trading profits and said it would buy back another $2.5 billion in shares.

Fox Corp. CEO Lachlan Murdoch touted the value of scale on a call with analysts about the firm's results.

Chip maker AMD issued a glum sales outlook for the current quarter.

What's News: Business & Finance
